Posted By: Kryptnyt (3/21/2011 2:10:20 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @land\_comment ...Really? Did you read the card? Wheel of Fortune can get you cards when you have none...and forces your opponent to discard. Winds of Change only gets you different cards from the ones you have, with no discard disadvantage for your opponent. When played right, Wheel of Fortune can get you 7 cards from nothing, and make your opponent lose 7 cards, and possibly draw crap. Winds of Change only shuffles everything up for no good reason. Read before you post.
posts.html:
@land_comment ...Really? Did you read the card? Wheel of Fortune can get you cards when you have none...and forces your opponent to discard. Winds of Change only gets you different cards from the ones you have, with no discard disadvantage for your opponent. Posted By: AvatarofBro (1/8/2012 8:01:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I Love this card. A few years ago when I started working on a new version of Vercursion (A type of deck that used to be AWESOME before the restriction of Fastbond and other nice stuff, but, either way, can still work) and anyway, so, I'm working on this deck, and I'd been at it for months tracking down exactly what I needed, and then working out how I'd play. I ended up making like 5 versions of the deck, and one of them had Black in it, so, I made it with this:
  
   
4 - Underworld Dreams
  
4 - Verduran Enchantress
  
1 - Wheel of Fortune
  
1 - Fork
  
   
And then a couple Twincast and Ali from Cairo and Platinum Angel and started working out what I wanted to do.
  
   
I went to the game shop I played at all the time, and brought it with me. Well, it was a particularly busy night at the shop, and I had a couple decks with me, including this one. I went with my Wife who was playing a deck She had made, and then my Cousin was there with a few of his decks, a... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

I'm playing red. What? What is that, you say? Red only has one strategy: burn? Well [Strategy, Schmategy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Strategy, Schmategy) I say, mate!
